title: The Heidelberg Catechism: A Historical, Theological, and Pastoral Commentary
summary: Comprehensive 1,060-page commentary reflecting on the catechism's theology, piety, and practice, commenting on each of its 129 questions. Published 2025.
recommended_for: Pastors, seminary students, serious Bible students
notes: Published by Lexham Press. Major new release from Westminster Seminary California professor.

title: The Heidelberg Catechism, 450th Anniversary Edition
authors: The Reformed Church in the United States
summary: 450th Anniversary Edition with all references in NKJV and updated language adopted by RCUS Synod in 2011.

title: The Heidelberg Catechism With Scripture Texts
summary: Complete catechism with all supporting Scripture texts (NIV) printed out for easy reference.
notes: Includes full scripture references printed out

title: The Heidelberg Catechism
summary: Standard edition of the Heidelberg Catechism by P&R Publishing. Soundly Calvinistic, moderate in tone and irenic in spirit.

title: The Heidelberg Catechism (Gift Editions)
summary: Pocket-sized gift edition from Banner of Truth's Pocket Puritan series. Beautiful soft imitation leather cover with engraved text.
tags: catechism, gift edition, pocket puritan, leather
notes: Banner of Truth Pocket Puritan series, 88 pages

title: The Heidelberg Catechism: True Comfort for Life & Death
summary: Kindle edition based on the Canadian Reformed Churches version, lightly revised with ESV Bible quotations.

title: My Only Comfort: The Heidelberg Catechism for Devotional Reading
summary: Devotional format edition of the Heidelberg Catechism designed for daily reading and reflection.

title: Study Helps on the Heidelberg Catechism
summary: Studies intended to help lead covenant youth into the riches of the Heidelberg Catechism.

title: The Commentary of Dr. Zacharias Ursinus on the Heidelberg Catechism
summary: Classic commentary by the principal author of the Heidelberg Catechism. Compiled from his lectures in Neustadt, Germany. Originally published posthumously in 1584, English translation from 1851.
notes: 2025 RFPA edition improved for readability. Also available free on Internet Archive.

title: The Heidelberg Catechism: A Study Guide
summary: Popular study guide with 129 questions and answers, clear exposition, and questions for review, further study, and discussion. Broken into 52 sections.
tags: study guide, discussion questions, group study
recommended_for: Small groups, Sunday school, personal study
notes: Published by P&R Publishing. Highly recommended by Kevin DeYoung.

title: The Good News We Almost Forgot: Rediscovering the Gospel in a 16th Century Catechism
summary: Explores the Heidelberg Catechism in 52 brief chapters on what DeYoung has learned from it. Popular modern treatment.
recommended_for: General readers, new to Reformed theology
notes: Also available from Ligonier Ministries. Includes sermon series.

title: The Christian's Only Comfort in Life and Death: An Exposition of the Heidelberg Catechism (2 Volumes)
authors: Theodorus VanderGroe, Bartel Elshout (translator), Joel Beeke (editor)
summary: Dutch Second Reformation commentary (1705-1784), magnum opus of VanderGroe. First English translation. Highly regarded alongside Brakel's work.
tags: commentary, Dutch Second Reformation, classic, experiential
notes: Published by Reformation Heritage Books. 2 volumes, comprehensive.

title: I Belong: Heidelberg Catechism Question and Answer 1 for Children
summary: Picture book for ages 4-7 explaining each phrase of Heidelberg Catechism Q&A 1 to young children with colorful illustrations.

title: Comforting Hearts, Teaching Minds: Family Devotions Based on the Heidelberg Catechism
summary: Takes families with school-age children through The Heidelberg Catechism with short devotional readings and Bible passages. Provides a year or more of family devotions.
notes: Available from Reformation Heritage Books and other retailers

title: An Introduction to the Heidelberg Catechism: Sources, History, and Theology
authors: Lyle D. Bierma, Charles D. Gunnoe Jr., Karin Maag, Paul W. Fields
summary: Scholarly examination of historical background, socio-political origins, purpose, authorship, sources, and theology. Includes first English translations of Ursinus's Smaller and Larger Catechisms.
notes: Baker Academic, Texts and Studies in Reformation series

title: The Theology of the Heidelberg Catechism: A Reformation Synthesis
summary: Published for 450th anniversary, explores the catechism in historical setting and emphasizes integration of Lutheran and Reformed traditions.
notes: Westminster John Knox Press, Columbia Series in Reformed Theology

title: A Faith Worth Teaching: The Heidelberg Catechism's Enduring Heritage
authors: Jon D. Payne, Sebastian Heck (editors), contributors: Joel Beeke, Michael Horton, Lyle Bierma, D.G. Hart, and others
summary: Multi-author volume examining various aspects of the Heidelberg Catechism. Includes chapters on justification, baptism, preaching, and church.
notes: Reformation Heritage Books. Endorsed by Sinclair Ferguson.

title: Our Only Comfort: A Comprehensive Commentary on the Heidelberg Catechism (2 Volume Set)
summary: Comprehensive 1,272-page commentary (2 volumes) with full catechism texts in German and English, detailed expositions, word studies, doctrinal summaries, and applications. Klooster's last major work.
notes: Published by Faith Alive Christian Resources. Highly regarded modern commentary.

title: Heidelberg Catechism Sermons (2 volumes)
summary: Comprehensive sermon series through all 52 Lord's Days. 2 volumes, 1,922 pages total. Earlier edition in 5 volumes also available.
notes: Published by RHB. Comprehensive expository preaching.

title: Living and Dying in Joy: A Devotional Guide to the Heidelberg Catechism
authors: Cornelis Vonk, Jordan J. Ballor, Nelson D. Kloosterman
summary: Devotional guide focusing on biblical background and exposition of misery, redemption, and gratitude. Published for 450th anniversary.
recommended_for: Personal devotions, family worship, children's classes
notes: Also available on Logos Bible Software and Acton Institute

title: Our Only Comfort: 52 Reflections on the Heidelberg Catechism
summary: 52 reflections on the Heidelberg Catechism for personal meditation and group study.
notes: Published by Westminster John Knox Press

title: Learning Jesus Christ through the Heidelberg Catechism
authors: Karl Barth, Shirley C. Guthrie Jr. (translator)
summary: Two essays for 400th anniversary: question-by-question interpretation and introduction examining fundamental questions. Provides glimpse of Barth's theology.
notes: Originally published by Eerdmans. Now available from Wipf and Stock.

title: The Spirituality of the Heidelberg Catechism: Papers of the International Conference
summary: Conference proceedings from June 2013 at Theological University Apeldoorn. Papers on catechism's spirituality from historical and theological perspectives.
notes: Vandenhoeck & Ruprecht, Refo500 Academic Studies series, Vol. 24

title: Power of Faith: 450 Years of the Heidelberg Catechism
summary: 440-page volume with conference papers from March 2011. Includes over 700 photographs depicting objects in exhibition.
notes: Vandenhoeck & Ruprecht. Conference supported by Johannes A Lasco Library.

title: The Heidelberg Catechism (1988 Translation)
summary: 1975 translation updated in 1988, approved by the synod of the Christian Reformed Church.

title: The Heidelberg Catechism (2011 Translation)
authors: Christian Reformed Church and other Reformed/Presbyterian churches
summary: Fresh and accurate 2011 translation from 1563 German and Latin texts. Ecumenical effort recommended for Reformed and Presbyterian churches.
notes: Developed by pastors and scholars from various Reformed/Presbyterian churches

title: Creeds and Confessions (includes Heidelberg Catechism)
summary: 174-page publication including Ecumenical Creeds and Three Forms of Unity (Belgic, Heidelberg, Canons of Dort).

title: Heidelberg Catechism Audio Recording from URC Learning
summary: 52-episode podcast featuring audio recordings of the Heidelberg Catechism, one of the Three Forms of Unity.
notes: Available on Apple Podcasts and urclearning.org

title: Heidelberg Catechism Curriculum for Families from URC Learning
summary: Free downloadable curriculum for families with printable workbooks. Designed for church families and home use.

title: The Heidelberg Catechism Podcast
summary: Podcast series arranged in 52 Lord's Days taking Christians through basics of the Christian faith.

title: Heidelberg Catechism - LibriVox Audiobook
summary: Free public domain audiobook of the Heidelberg Catechism available for download and streaming.

title: Heidelberg Catechism Sermons - Sheffield Presbyterian Church
summary: 35-sermon series on various questions of the catechism, available on SermonAudio.

title: Heidelberg Catechism - GIW Sermon Series
summary: 51-sermon series by Rev. G.I. Williamson from Covenant OPC.
notes: By the author of the popular study guide

title: First United Reformed Church of Oak Lawn - Heidelberg Catechism Series
summary: 61-sermon series spanning October 2021 to May 2025.

title: Covenant United Reformed Church - Heidelberg Catechism Series
summary: Comprehensive 131-sermon series covering all Lord's Days.

title: Emmanuel Free Reformed Church - Heidelberg Catechism Series
summary: 20-sermon series from October 2023 to November 2024.
tags: sermons, audio, free, Free Reformed, recent

title: Christ Covenant Church - Heidelberg Catechism Sermon Series (Kevin DeYoung Archive)
summary: Sermon series by Kevin DeYoung on the Heidelberg Catechism.
notes: By author of 'The Good News We Almost Forgot'

title: Herman Hoeksema - Complete Set of HC Sermons
summary: Complete sermon series preached in the 1930s at First PRC Grand Rapids. Available in PDF form.

title: PRCA Heidelberg Catechism Sermons Archive
summary: Collection of written sermons, sermon outlines, and audio recordings from Protestant Reformed Churches covering all 52 Lord's Days.

title: Heritage Recordings - Heidelberg Catechism Sermons
summary: Free MP3/WMA downloads of Heidelberg Catechism sermons from Reformed Free Publishing Association.

title: TheSeed.info - Heidelberg Catechism Sermon Archive
summary: Written Reformed sermons organized by Lord's Day, solidly Reformed text sermons.
notes: Organized by Lord's Day for easy navigation

title: Classic Studies on the Heidelberg Catechism (16 vols.)
authors: Various authors including Henry J. Kuiper, George W. Richards, Otto Thelemann
summary: Late-19th and early-20th century studies, 16 volumes, nearly 5,000 pages. Digital collection on Logos.

title: Heidelberg Catechism in German, Latin and English: With an Historical Introduction
summary: Critical edition containing the catechism in all three original languages with historical introduction.
notes: Available on Internet Archive and Logos

title: The Heidelberg Catechism: A New Translation for the 21st Century
summary: Modern 21st century translation of the Heidelberg Catechism.

title: The Heidelberg Catechism: The German text, with a revised translation and introduction
summary: German original with revised English translation and scholarly introduction.

title: Notes on the Heidelberg Catechism for Parents, Teachers and Catechumens
summary: Historical study notes designed for parents, teachers, and those learning the catechism.

title: The Heidelberg Catechism in its Newest Light
summary: Historical examination of the Heidelberg Catechism by James I. Good.
notes: Also available on Logos Bible Software

title: Aid to the Heidelberg Catechism
summary: Study aid resource for understanding the Heidelberg Catechism, available on Logos.

title: The Heidelberg Catechism: Historical and Doctrinal Studies
summary: Collection of historical and doctrinal studies on the Heidelberg Catechism.

title: Baker Academic Heidelberg Catechism Collection (2 vols.)
summary: Two-volume Baker Academic collection examining sources, history, theology. Includes first English translations of Ursinus' Smaller and Larger Catechisms.

title: Reformed Confessions Harmonized
summary: Seven important confessional statements harmonized in parallel columns, including Heidelberg Catechism, Belgic Confession, Canons of Dort, Westminster Standards.
notes: Endorsed by R.C. Sproul. Also available from Monergism Books.

title: Trinity Psalter Hymnal
summary: Hymnal including 428 hymns, 278 Psalter selections, and the Three Forms of Unity plus Westminster Standards in the back. First hymnal to feature both confessional traditions together.
notes: Includes full text of Heidelberg Catechism

title: Heidelberg Catechism Songs - Jeremy Zeyl Project
summary: Ongoing project setting words of Heidelberg Catechism to modern music for corporate worship. CD includes booklet with all text and catechism references.
notes: Modern musical setting for congregational use

title: Heidelberg Catechism Coloring Book
authors: Ying Liang, Shengqiang Liu, Philip Miti
summary: 460th anniversary edition coloring book with 22 illustrative line drawings. Interactive journey for children to create personalized illustrated book.

title: Heidelberg Catechism Flashcards - Quizlet
summary: Digital flashcards for memorizing Heidelberg Catechism questions and answers on Quizlet platform.

title: Printable Catechism Memorization Cards - Etsy
summary: Printable memorization cards for Heidelberg Catechism questions 1-30.

title: Heidelberg-Catechism.com Official Website
summary: Growing online collection of resources including teaching outlines, sermons, articles, translations, photos, videos, and audio recordings.
notes: Sponsored by Canadian Reformed Theological Seminary. Multilingual.

title: URC Learning - Heidelberg Catechism Resources
authors: United Reformed Churches in North America
summary: Free curriculum, audio, video, and teaching resources. Includes family curriculum and mobile resources.
notes: Comprehensive free resources including curriculum and mobile app

title: Center for Excellence in Preaching - Heidelberg Catechism Resources
summary: Catechism sermon commentaries with fresh angles, Scripture suggestions, and illustration ideas for contemporary preaching.

title: The Heidelblog Resources
summary: Comprehensive blog with articles, resources, bibliography, and podcast on the Heidelberg Catechism.
notes: Maintained by Westminster Seminary California professor

title: Blue Letter Bible - Heidelberg Catechism
summary: Online reference for Heidelberg Catechism with creeds and confessions.
notes: Part of larger Bible study resource

title: Understand the Bible - Heidelberg Catechism Course
summary: Free video course with sessions uploaded to YouTube and Facebook. Complete playlist available.

title: Spotify - Survey of the Heidelberg Catechism
summary: Audio survey of the Heidelberg Catechism available on Spotify, curating theological resources in Reformed Catholic tradition.

title: Exploring the Heidelberg Catechism - New Brunswick Theological Seminary
summary: Online continuing education course examining text, composition, history, and traditional and contemporary readings.

title: The Theology of the Heidelberg Catechism - Davenant Hall Course
summary: Theological course on the Heidelberg Catechism offered through Davenant Institute (Spring 2021 term).

title: THE HEIDELBERG CATECHISM AND ITS 350th ANNIVERSARY IN 1913
summary: JSTOR article from Journal of the Presbyterian Historical Society, Vol. 7, No. 2 (June 1913), pp. 96-104.

title: Olevianus and the Authorship of the Heidelberg Catechism: Another Look
summary: Scholarly article in The Sixteenth Century Journal, Vol. 13, No. 4 (Winter 1982), pp. 17-27. Examines authorship questions.

title: The Heidelberg Catechism: A 16th century quest for unity
summary: South African journal article examining the catechism as a unifying document in 16th century context.

title: On the historical origins of the Heidelberg Catechism
summary: Academic article examining the historical origins of the catechism.

title: Justification in the Heidelberg Catechism
summary: Article in Journal of Reformed Theology, Volume 15 Issue 1-2 (2021) examining justification doctrine.

title: Heidelberg Catechism Mobile App
summary: Mobile app for studying Heidelberg Catechism on the go. Available for iOS and Android.

title: The Heidelberg Diary: Daily Devotions on the Heidelberg Catechism
summary: Daily devotional walking through the Heidelberg Catechism. 52 Lord's Days expanded to last all year with 4-5 parts per question/answer.

title: Heidelberg Catechism 1563 - Utrecht University Special Collections
summary: Utrecht University owns most copies of first 1563 editions in the world. Digital access to facsimile editions.
notes: Access to original 1563 editions. 2013 facsimile published.

title: Take A Moment - Heidelberg Catechism for Children
summary: Explanations of Heidelberg Catechism for younger children (about 8 years and older). Each Lord's Day available as separate downloadable document.

title: MAJT: Books on the Heidelberger - An Annotated Bibliography
summary: Comprehensive annotated bibliography of Heidelberg Catechism resources. MAJT 24 (2013): 5-30.

title: The Heidelblog Bibliography of Confessions and Catechisms
summary: Comprehensive bibliography of resources on Reformed confessions and catechisms including extensive Heidelberg Catechism section.

title: Canadian Reformed Theological Seminary - Heidelberg Catechism Resources
summary: Videos, presentations, and resources including Rev. Peter Feenstra's multi-year curriculum and teaching approach.

title: William Ames - The Substance of Christian Religion
summary: 52 lectures on chosen Scripture texts for each Lord's Day. Puritan's commentary on the Continental Heidelberg Catechism. Originally published 1659.
notes: Also titled 'A Sketch of the Christian's Catechism'
